newsitem.title: FRANCE: Striking French doctors maintain pressure.
newsitem.headline: Striking French doctors maintain pressure.

text.p: Striking French junior hospital doctors maintained their pressure on the authorities on Tuesday, demonstrating outside the Health Ministry and preventing the departure of trains from stations across the country.
The doctors, whose strike is in its 22nd day, are protesting against the government's plan to cap costs in the health service.

While several hundred doctors demonstrated outside the Health Ministry in Paris, their counterparts disturbed traffic by sitting on railway tracks in stations at Angouleme, Bordeaux, Caen, Dijon, Lille, Lyon, Montpellier and Poitiers.
Police removed them in most cases, but said trains were delayed for up to 90 minutes.
The junior doctors, on strike in 22 of the country's 26 teaching hospitals, are demanding the scrapping of automatic fines on doctors in regions which exceed government health spending targets.
The government is determined to go ahead with the reform, which is part of its drive to bring down the welfare deficit and help France qualify for a single European currency in 1999.
Social Affairs Minister Jacques Barrot has said the measure was essential as a safeguard against overspending until new standard medical procedures take root.
